fields_of_interest: Culture and media, Culture, Digital economy and society
eu_initiatives: We respond to EU consultations that will directly affect our members particularly through Directives concerning Collective Rights, Copyright and the Digital Single Market.
organisation_name: British Academy of Songwriters, Composers & Authors (BASCA)
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership:
We are members of various UK organisations such as the British Copyright Council and UK Music.   
http://www.britishcopyright.org/ 
http://www.ukmusic.org/   
 
We are also key members of ECSA, the European Composer and Songwriter Alliance, based in Brussels.  
http://composeralliance.org/
goals__remit:
BASCA exists to support and protect the professional interests of songwriters, lyricists and composers of all genres of music and to celebrate and encourage excellence in British music writing. 
 
We have pledged to achieve that mission by carrying out the following objectives: 
• To campaign as a leading force in the domestic, European and international political arenas. 
• To celebrate excellence through world-class awards ceremonies – The Ivor Novello 
Awards, the British Composer Awards and the Gold Badge Awards. 
• To provide services and to inform our members through our publications, websites and seminars. 
• To foster a sense of community amongst British songwriters, lyricists and composers. 
• To encourage the next generation of professional music writers.
relevant_communication: We explain our activity here http://basca.org.uk/public-affairs/
legal_status: Not for profit company limited by guarantee
